title: How to Make a Key Lime Martini

steps.headline: Cut the lime in half.
steps.description: Then, cut a wedge from one side of the lime.

steps.headline: Cut down the center of the wedge.
steps.description: Place the lime wedge on the rim of the glass, and then run the lime wedge around the rim to leave juice on the rim. At this point, do not leave the lime wedge on the rim.

steps.headline: Pour some sugar on a plate and run the rim of the glass in the pile so the sugar can stick to the lime juice on the rim.
steps.description: Using a wide rim glass allows for more sugar on the rim. The sugar rim helps the taste of the drink and so it is important that with each sip the drinker has sugar left on the rim to taste.

steps.headline: Place the lime wedge back on the glass rim for decoration.
Squeeze the rest of the lime into the glass for juice.
Measure out 4 ounces (120ml) of pineapple juice (about 4 shots worth) and pour into glass.
Measure out 2 ounces (60ml) of vanilla vodka (about 2 shots worth) and pour into glass.

text: Cut the lime in half. Then, cut a wedge from one side of the lime. Cut down the center of the wedge. Place the lime wedge on the rim of the glass, and then run the lime wedge around the rim to leave juice on the rim. At this point, do not leave the lime wedge on the rim. Pour some sugar on a plate and run the rim of the glass in the pile so the sugar can stick to the lime juice on the rim. Using a wide rim glass allows for more sugar on the rim. The sugar rim helps the taste of the drink and so it is important that with each sip the drinker has sugar left on the rim to taste. Place the lime wedge back on the glass rim for decoration.  Squeeze the rest of the lime into the glass for juice.  Measure out 4 ounces (120ml) of pineapple juice (about 4 shots worth) and pour into glass.  Measure out 2 ounces (60ml) of vanilla vodka (about 2 shots worth) and pour into glass.  Stir, add ice, and enjoy.
